page.title: 04HOUSING IMPROVEMENTS,IPSWICH
page.content: The large residential areas in South-east Ipswich are being improved steadily.An example is the 'Racecourse' area,where Ipswich Borough Council take old housing and renovates the area rather than deciding to demolish it and start again. The local council made the decision to renovate rather than demolish to improve the quality of life in an area without causing too much disturbance. Small areas are taken at a time (Packard Arenue is currently being improved),the residents are temporarily moved to other areas. The houses are gutted, new windows and roofs are obvious features, but basic indoor facilites are also replaced. The area is pleasent and is improving over time,not decaying.
